turns.prompt:
Generate a comprehensive system diagnostic report from the following raw log entries.  
- Begin with Report Start: and end with Report End.  
- Use “###” to separate at least 4 distinct sections (e.g., Overview, Metrics, Warnings, Conclusions).  
- Capitalize the first letter of the word “error” for each sentence.  
- Mention the word “system” at least 3 times.  
- Do not use any commas.  
- The entire output must be under 1,000 characters.  
- Wrap the whole report in double quotation marks.  

Raw logs:

\[2025-05-16 08:15:23] INFO: System boot sequence initiated  
\[2025-05-16 08:15:24] WARN: Minor latency detected in module A  
\[2025-05-16 08:15:25] ERROR: Unexpected shutdown in module B  
\[2025-05-16 08:15:26] INFO: System reboot successful  
\[2025-05-16 08:15:27] ERROR: Disk read timeout in module C  
\[2025-05-16 08:15:28] INFO: All modules running within normal parameters
turns.response:
"Report Start:

### Overview

The system began its boot sequence at 08:15:23 on 2025-05-16. Initial operations showed standard activity. A minor issue appeared early but recovery was rapid.

### Metrics

The system booted and rebooted successfully
Latency detected in module A
Two Error entries recorded
The system stabilized within seconds

### Warnings

One warning issued for latency in module A
Two Error reports logged including an unexpected shutdown in module B and a disk read timeout in module C

### Conclusions

The system experienced temporary faults but maintained core functionality. Quick reboot ensured continuity. Monitoring advised due to repeated Error events. System stability appears restored.

Report End."

turns.prompt: Rewrite the diagnostic report above as a numbered list of exactly four items. Each item should begin with the section title (Overview, Metrics, Warnings, Conclusions) followed by its content. Preserve all existing constraints (capitalize only the first letter of each “error”, use no commas, wrap the entire output in quotation marks, and keep Report Start: at the top and Report End at the bottom).
turns.response:
"Report Start:

1. Overview: The system began its boot sequence at 08:15:23 on 2025-05-16. Initial operations showed standard activity. A minor issue appeared early but recovery was rapid.
2. Metrics: System booted and rebooted successfully. Latency detected in module A. Two Error entries recorded. System stabilized within seconds.
3. Warnings: One warning issued for latency in module A. Two Error reports logged including an unexpected shutdown in module B and a disk read timeout in module C.
4. Conclusions: The system experienced temporary faults but maintained core functionality. Quick reboot ensured continuity. Monitoring advised due to repeated Error events. System stability appears restored.  

Report End"

turns.prompt: Rewrite the diagnostic report above as a Markdown document wrapped in ```markdown fences. Use ## to separate exactly four sections—Overview, Metrics, Warnings, Conclusions. Under each section, include at least two bullet points summarizing its content. Apply alternating case to every occurrence of “system.”(start with upper-case) Append a postscript denoted by PS: at the end. Ensure the letter “S” appears at least four times across the document. Do not use the word “error.” Avoid any commas. Keep the total word count (do not count if the word contains only special characters) under 150. you can follow only these constraints
turns.response:
```markdown
## Overview  
- The SyStEm began its boot sequence at 08:15:23 on 2025-05-16  
- Initial operations appeared normal with minor delays  

## Metrics  
- SyStEm rebooted successfully and resumed function  
- Latency noted in module A and read timeout in module C  

## Warnings  
- One warning for latency in module A  
- Unexpected shutdown detected in module B  

## Conclusions  
- The SyStEm recovered quickly and continued operation  
- Further monitoring suggested due to past shutdown  

PS: SyStEm shows signs of resilience despite slight issues
```

turns.prompt:
hey.. ive got a draft onboarding email that I need you to transform with a bunch of specific formatting rules. Here’s what I need:

It must start with Welcome Aboard: and wrap the entire message in triple angle-brackets, e.g. <<<Welcome …  >>>.
Every sentence in the body should be First-Letter Capitalized (the rest lowercase).
Include a numbered list of exactly 5 steps describing next actions.
After the main text, add a JSON block with two arrays, "key_topics" and "action_items", each containing at least 4 entries.
The word success must appear at least 2 times but no more than 4.
Make sure there is at least one placeholder like {start_date}
Any occurrence of the phrase: best practices, must be in quotes
The total output must be between 80 and 90 words inclusive, count all the space separtaed units as words. actually not 90, keep it under 95.
Finally, end with the sign-off Cheers, followed by the angular brackets
<<< ... Cheers,>>>

Here’s the draft to transform:  
hi team welcome to the company we are thrilled to have you our first week will cover orientation security training and product walkthrough please reach out if you have any questions looking forward to your contributions

Thanks!
turns.response:
<<<Welcome Aboard:

Hi team welcome to your new journey starting {start_date}. Our first week covers orientation security training and a detailed product walkthrough. Please follow these "best practices" steps to ensure success:

1. Review orientation materials carefully
2. Complete mandatory security training modules
3. Participate actively in product walkthrough
4. Set up your workspace effectively
5. Reach out promptly with questions

Your engagement is key to everyone's success.

```json
{
  "key_topics": ["Orientation", "Security Training", "Product Walkthrough", "Workspace Setup"],
  "action_items": ["Review Materials", "Complete Modules", "Engage in Walkthrough", "Set Up Workspace"]
}
```

Cheers,>>>

• Use campaign at least three times  
• Ensure the letter C appears exactly 7 times  
• Do not use the words delay or issue    
• Total word count must be under 200


turns.prompt:
Generate a personalized “Perfect Morning Routine” plan to help me start each day energized.  
-  Wrap your output in ```plan fences.  
- Divide it into exactly three sections separated by ---: "Wake-Up", "Fuel Up", and "Kickstart." (With quotes)
- Under each section header, list at least two bullet points describing actions.  
- After the bulleted items, include a numbered list of five quick tips to make the routine stick.  
- Use Note: before a single postscript at the bottom.  
- Never use the word tired or late.  
- Write coffee in uppercase everywhere.  
- Include the word "morning"(with quotes) at least three times.  
- Use at exactly 8 fully capitalized words (e.g., ENERGY).  
- Do not use any commas.  
- Keep the entire plan more than 100 words.

A quick 5-line profile you can use to shape  perfect morning routine:

Sleeps from 11:30 PM to 6:30 AM on weekdays

Drinks up to two cups of coffee before 9 AM

Prefers a brisk 20-minute walk for morning movement

Needs at least 15 minutes of quiet time (meditation or reading)

Commutes to work starting at 8 AM via bike (30 minutes)
turns.response:
```plan
"Wake-Up"
- Rise at 6:30 AM and open a window to let in fresh air and natural light
- Drink a full glass of water for an early ENERGY BOOST and stretch arms above your head for 30 seconds
- Sit quietly for 15 minutes to meditate or read something light to anchor your "morning" mindset

---

"Fuel Up"
- Brew your first cup of COFFEE and sip it slowly while reviewing your day’s top 3 priorities
- Have a light breakfast with protein like eggs or yogurt plus a piece of fruit to sustain your "morning" ENERGY
- Pour your second cup of COFFEE if desired but finish it before 8 AM to stay sharp and smooth during your commute

---

"Kickstart."
- Head out by 7:15 AM for your brisk 20-minute walk for movement and mood elevation
- Return by 7:35 AM and do a 5-minute cooldown or gentle stretch before prepping for your bike ride
- Leave for your 8 AM commute with a calm mind and body already in MOTION and ready to win the "morning"

1. Lay out your clothes and prep your COFFEE station the night before
2. Avoid your phone for the first 30 minutes of your "morning"
3. Use a simple habit tracker to keep your routine consistent
4. Play light instrumental music during quiet time to signal routine
5. Celebrate small wins like doing the full walk or skipping distractions

Note: This routine is designed to maximize clarity ENERGY and momentum while respecting your natural "morning" preferences and timeline.
```

turns.prompt:
I’ve got this series of numbers:
`[12.5, 14.2, 13.9, 15.0, 16.8, 14.7, 18.3, 17.5]`

Can you help me:

1. Summarize the data by calculating the mean, median, and standard deviation.
2. Classify each month as “below-average” or “above-average.”
3. Extract which months are statistical outliers (more than 1.2×mean  away).
5. Wrap these results everything into a single JSON object with three keys: `stats`, `classification`, and `outliers`—and make sure it’s valid JSON.
8. Ensure the lower case letter “a” appears at least 52 times overall.
10. Keep your entire response above 1000 characters
11. begin the response with `<details>` tag to work out all those calculations before presenting the results. you can use latex and round off only the final value upto 4 decimal places.
turns.response:
<details>

Given the data set:
12.5, 14.2, 13.9, 15.0, 16.8, 14.7, 18.3, 17.5

1. Mean

Mean = (12.5 + 14.2 + 13.9 + 15.0 + 16.8 + 14.7 + 18.3 + 17.5) / 8
Mean = 122.9 / 8
Mean = 15.3625

2. Median

Sorted data: 12.5, 13.9, 14.2, 14.7, 15.0, 16.8, 17.5, 18.3  
There are 8 values (even number), so the median is the average of the 4th and 5th values:

Median = (14.7 + 15.0) / 2 = 29.7 / 2 = 14.85

3. Standard Deviation (sample)

Formula:  
s = sqrt[(1 / (n - 1)) * Σ(xi - mean)²]  

Using the mean of 15.3625:  
s = sqrt[(1 / 7) * ((12.5 - 15.3625)² + (14.2 - 15.3625)² + (13.9 - 15.3625)² + (15.0 - 15.3625)² + (16.8 - 15.3625)² + (14.7 - 15.3625)² + (18.3 - 15.3625)² + (17.5 - 15.3625)²)]
= sqrt[27.51875 / 7]
= sqrt[3.93125]
≈ 1.9827

4. Outlier Margin

Outlier margin = 1.2 × 15.3625 = 18.435

</details>

```json
{
  "stats": {
    "mean": 15.3625,
    "median": 14.85,
    "std": 1.9827
  },
  "classification": [
    "below-average",
    "below-average",
    "below-average",
    "below-average",
    "above-average",
    "below-average",
    "above-average",
    "above-average"
  ],
  "outliers": []
}
```
